etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in Richard Cambridge (1717–1802), poet and essayist. From Malayalam pēṭṭa and Tamil pēṭṭai, probably ultimately from Sanskrit pratiṣṭhā establishment

definitions: In Sri Lanka and southern India: a town or village lying outside or around a fort, and itself sometimes partly fortified.
"the Pettah": the traditional market area of Colombo.
